I tried this as I read that this brush has many more bristles than other brushes, but this is too soft to use after using the standard type for 3 decades. I'll try for another month and will update the review if I feel any different. It reaches the corners of mouth much better, but it's just too soft.

I was looking for a replacement to Colgate Charcoal toothbrush which I am using for years. I ordered this after seeing the description and reviews, expecting softer bristles but turns out it has similar softness to charcoal one, just that bristle density is high. It does feel a bit soft but for initial few uses only.A bit disappointed with the brush, considering its costing more than double of what charcoal one costs and the term ultrafoam it a bit misleading. So, I'll be going back to the previous one.Only pros would be ergonomic soft handle and high density of bristles.You may go for it, if you want wider coverage i.e. cover more area in less time.
Bristles are NOT soft. After 4 days shape distorted
Feels like a medium soft not a ultra soft  brush
I bought it after seeing ads on Instagram then I found out that 10k plus bristlles are good at cleaning teeths but, honestly I would go simple brush with soft brittles.

Bought this toothbrush for myself and my wife and we were happy with the coloring scheme.The brush head was very small but it helped in taking the right amoumt of tooth paste and we never had the problem of taking extra toothpaste than required.The bristles were very densely packed, never used anything like this before. This certainly gave me much better confidence in cleaning each tooth and I was able to concentrate on the right areas for cleaning.The bristles were very soft and never harsh on the gums. At the same time the dense and pointed bristles was able to clean much better than my previous regular sized toothbrushes.But I have been notificing this issue of bristles in the lower end of the toothbrush being bent of at angle when taken right out of the box. I saw this on the enamel protection series as well. This looks like quality wasn't taken care much by Colgate. In this pack of 2 only 1 brush had this bent brsitles but seems common in the new series from Colgate.Handle of the toothbrush is soft to grip and strong to prevent bending.Overall a good toothbrush for cleaning tooth, but price is higher and quality of bristles alignment is something that should be looked upon.
Bristles size is too small. Colgate gentle enamal is much better toothbrush.

My sensodyne is far better than this and much softer.CONCLUSION- I'm gonna use this brush to clean something else than my teeth. Use sensodyne it's nuch better. He talks about how to correctly brush your teeth. I watched that video and it really does help.
